question: The process of shaving off small amounts of metal using handheld tools. This process is most often done to obtain precision alignment of machine parts; it is also done to provide shallow pockets that will hold lubricants on flat surfaces, such as machine ways.
Means putting the parts of something together.

Tools used to turn, or drive, screws; made in many sizes and several shapes; the size is measured by the length of the blade, which is made of tool steel that is hardened and tempered. The screwdriver point for driving slotted screws should be correctly shaped; it must fit the slot in the screw.

A place in which metal parts are cut to the size required and put together to form mechanical units of machines, the machine so made to be used directly or indirectly in the production of the necessities and luxuries of civilization.

A metal-turning machine tool in which the work, while revolving on a horizontal axis, is acted upon by a cutting tool which is made to move slowly (feed) in a direction more or less parallel to the axis of the work (longitudinal feed), or in a direction at right angles to the axis of work (cross feed).
This screwdriver has a bent handle; it is used where a straight screwdriver will not reach.
A machine tool used mainly for producing holes in metal.
Tools used for cutting small wire and for holding, twisting, turning, pulling, and pushing.
A machine which is ordinarily used for finishing flat or partly curved surfaces of metal pieces few in number and not usually over a foot or too long.
A machine tool in which an abrasive wheel is used as a cutting tool to obtain a very high degree of accuracy and a smooth finish on metal parts, including soft and hardened steel.
A file which is thick, rectangular-shaped file with parallel edges.
A file which is tapered in thickness and of uniform width. This is used for filing slots and keyways.
Also known as combination pliers, are used for gripping; can also cut small-size wire; the slip-joint makes it possible to grip large parts.
Which of the following does not belong to standard shapes of file?
One of the three basic ways of using a file which is done by pushing the file lengthwise, straight with or slightly diagonal to the workpiece.
One of the three basic ways of using a file which consists of stroking the file against the revolving workpiece held in the lathe.
One of the three basic ways of using a file which is performed by grasping the file at end and pushing and drawing across the workpiece.
A hand tool which is commonly used for cutting or twisting wire and chipping small parts and not to be used for tightening or loosening bolts and nuts.
A type of pliers which is used for cutting wires and holding flat round stock.
choices: Slip joint combination pliers or mechanical pliers
answer: Slip joint combination pliers or mechanical pliers

question: A type of pliers which is used in electrical works for cutting heavy or light wires or for cutting small nails.
A type of pliers which is used for cutting and holding fine wire. This is also useful in reaching tight places.

question: _____________ is a handy tool. It works in close places and the strong steel jaws lock to the work and will not slip; it acts like a vise, clamp, plier, pipe wrench, open-end wrench, or locking tool.
A ratchet screw is provided on a micrometer screw gauge to:
choices: Maintain constant measuring pressure for all readings
answer: Maintain constant measuring pressure for all readings

question: _____________ is a machine for pressing parts of machinery together or forcing them apart, such as pressing a shaft in or out of a pulley or gear.

choices: Compensate for wear and tear between screw and nut
Maintain constant measuring pressure for all readings
answer: Compensate for wear and tear between screw and nut

question: External taper of a job can be measured accurately with the help of:

choices: Balls of standard size and dial indicator
Balls of standard size and sine bar
Balls of standard size and slip gauges
answer: Balls of standard size and slip gauges

choices: Measure cylindrical sizes of a length

choices: Cast iron and coated with chrome or molybdenum

question: Which of the following is a material used for a piston ring?
choices: Cast iron and coated with chrome or molybdenum
answer: Cast iron and coated with chrome or molybdenum

question: Which of the following is the typical material used for an engine crankshaft?
What is the function of a governor?
choices: Store energy and give up whatever is needed
Regulate the speed during one cycle of a prime mover
Adjust variation of speed by varying the input to the engine
answer: Adjust variation of speed by varying the input to the engine

question: What is a machine used in testing steel generally strike the specimen with energy from 220 to 265 ft-lb?

choices: One half of the shaft diameter
One fourth of the shaft diameter
One eighth of the shaft diameter
One third of the shaft diameter
answer: One fourth of the shaft diameter

question: This is defined as the cutting time to reach a predetermined wear, called the tool wear criterion.

choices: Silica sand, bentonite, flour/paste, and water
answer: Silica sand, bentonite, flour/paste, and water

question: Which of the following is not part of a micrometer caliper?

Have the same thermal and minimum film thickness limitation as sleeve bearing.

choices: An association of employers, organization & individuals
A job of a safety director
The Foreman’s responsibility just as much as production
answer: The Foreman’s responsibility just as much as production

question: Alloy steel known for its resistance to corrosion, abrasion and wear that is usually ideal for mill grinding of ore in cement and concentrator application. It is usually combined with molybdenum to increase the depth hardening.
Cutting of internal threads of a workpiece can be produced by which of the following?
Which of the following milling operations is used to produce curved profiles, with cutters that have specially shaped teeth?
In screw threads, what is a pitch?
choices: The distance from a point on one thread to a corresponding point on the next thread measured parallel to the axis.
The distance of the full length of the thread
The distance from the bottom of a head on a bolt to the first thread.
The distance from the top of one thread to the bottom of the next thread
answer: The distance from a point on one thread to a corresponding point on the next thread measured parallel to the axis.

question: Tapered shanks are used on large drill presses so that:
choices: The drill can be centered more easily
The drill can be easily forced out of the sleeve with a drift
The shank will not turn when cutting
The shank can be ground when worn
answer: The drill can be centered more easily

question: It is a type of chuck wherein a workpiece with standard diameter or size could be attached fast and quick especially small size work of mass production. How do you call this type of chuck?

A support where one end is pinned and other is roller-supported.
Functions used to evaluate shear and moment diagrams, especially when discontinuities, such as concentrated load or moment, exist.

It is the linear interpolation between densities of alloy concentration.
Compounds of carbon and other elements forming long-chain molecules.
The stress above which stress is no longer linearly proportional to strain.

When a hot part is cooled suddenly by quenching, there is momentarily a high temperature gradient that induces a stress gradient. Some metal parts under certain conditions crack as a result. How do you call this phenomenon?

It is defined as the change in volume divided by the original volume.
Material that can sustain elongation greater than 5% before fracture is called:
The name given to a load whose value is constant over long time is:
It is the peak of the stress-strain curve and sometimes simply called as tensile strength. How do you call this?
It is a synergistic collection of machine elements. It is synergistic because as a design it represents an idea or concept greater than the sum of the individual parts. How do you call this?
How do you call the ratio of stress and strain?
What is the philosophy of involving many disciplines from the beginning of a design effort and keeping them involved throughout product development?

It is one of the design stages that may be found desirable to use field experience as a basis for further improvement of the product. Since the final product is available, it often becomes the model for evaluation during this design process. This stage is not always used in the design process. How do you call this?
That portion of the stress-strain diagram where there is a large increase in strain with little or no increase in stress is called as:

This is the first stage of design processes that determines whether it is both possible and profitable to undertake a given engineering project. The ideas generated during this stage of the design process generally consist of general statements about overall concepts rather than specific descriptions of hardware. How do you call this?
At this point in the stress-strain curve, the material experiences some amount of plastic strain and thus will not return to its original shape after release of the load.
This type of load is the one that is applied slowly and never removed. How do you call this load?
At the highest point of the stress-strain curve during the test, what highest stress on a test bar of the material is measured?

This is a stress when a given element of a load-carrying member is subjected to a certain level of tensile stress followed by the same level of compressive stress; the stress cycle is repeated many thousands of times. How do you call this type of stress?

These steels contain 30 to 50 points of carbon (0.30%-0.50%). Most machine elements having moderate to high strength requirements with fairly good ductility and moderate hardness requirements come from this group.
It is the process of increasing the hardness and strength of ductile material as it is plastically performed. How do you call this process?
Which of the following is the average density of leather belts?
As a flat belt drive designer, what must be the belt speed to make your design most economical?
As suggested by Taylor, what is the recommended initial tension of the belt?
Not adaptable to welding due to low tensile strength and poor ductility etc.
Bearing surface that completely surrounds the journal is also called:
The purpose of lubrication is as mentioned except:
Tools usually used in wood pattern making in the foundry shop.

This group of materials characterizes the high level of corrosion resistance offered by alloys in this group. To be classified in this group of material, the alloy must have a chromium content of at least 10%, and most have 12% to 18% chromium.
The ability of the material to absorb energy up to fracture.

These group of stainless steels fall into the AISI 200 and 300 series. They are general-purpose grades with moderate strength. Most are not heat-treatable, and their final properties are determined by the amount of working, with the resulting temper referred to as 1/4 hard, ½ hard, 3/4 hard, and full hard. These alloys are nonmagnetic and are typically used in food processing equipment.

These stainless steels belong to the AISI 400 series, designated as 405, 409, 430, 446, and so on. They are magnetic and perform well at elevated temperatures, from 1300°F to 1900°F (700°C-1040°C), depending on the alloy. They are not heat-treatable, but they can be cold-worked to improve properties. Typical applications include heat exchanger tubing, petroleum refining equipment, automotive trim, furnace parts, and chemical equipment.

These stainless steels are also members of the AISI 400 series, including 403, 410, 414, 416, 420, 431, and 440 types. They are magnetic, can be heat-treated, and have higher strength than the 200 and 300 series, while retaining good toughness. Typical uses include turbine engine parts, cutlery, scissors, pump parts, valve parts, surgical instruments, aircraft fittings, and marine hardware.

Most of these materials are designated by ASTM numbers established by the American Society for Testing and Materials. One common grade is ASTM A36, which has a minimum yield point of 36,000 psi (248 MPa) and is very ductile. It is basically a low-carbon, hot-rolled steel available in sheet, plate, bar, and structural shapes such as some wide-flange beams, American Standard beams, channels, and angles.
Compounds of metallic elements, most frequently oxides, nitrides, and carbides.

This material refers to a group of steels typically used for cutting tools, punches, dies, shearing blades, chisels, and similar uses. The numerous varieties of tool steel materials have been classified into seven general types. Whereas most uses of these steels are related to the field of manufacturing engineering, they are also pertinent to machine design where the ability to maintain a keen edge under abrasive conditions is required. Also, some of these steels have rather high shock resistance which may be desirable in machine components such as parts for mechanical clutches, pawls, blades, guides for moving materials, and clamps.
A material having different properties in all directions at a point in solid.

Parts subjected to repeated applications of loads or to stress conditions that vary with time over several thousands or millions of cycles fail because of the phenomenon of fatigue. Materials are tested under controlled cyclic loading to determine their ability to resist such repeated loads. The resulting data are reported as which of the following?
Which of the following is the other term for endurance strength?
A material having different properties in three mutually perpendicular directions at a point in solid and having three mutually perpendicular planes of material symmetry.
The onset of plastic deformation is called:
